page.title: 20TRANSPORT CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: In this truly rural district a car is a necessity not a luxury. Public transport is very infrequent,one bus every two hours to Crawley and Hay- wards Heath,the two nearest towns, and none at all after 6.0 p.m. or on Sun- days.Older children travel on coaches to Warden Park school at Cuckfield,but younger children are usually taken to school by car,especially if they live on an isolated farm.Many women drive, and a car is essentialto visit shops , the Doctor,dentist,banks or post office. Pensioners may purchase a card to allow half fare travel on buses, which is helpful if they live near the bus route. The railway from London to Brighton has stations near this area and is a quick and efficient way to travel. The report on Cuckfield Rural was provided by Handcross W.I.
